refnamediv.refpurpose: calls a function from a SOAP server and returns the result. value; deprecated, use SOAP_CLIENT () instead

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This calls a function from a SOAP server and returns the result as a return value. Params is an array of (Parameter name, Value) pairs representing the parameters passed in the SOAP call. Each of these pairs become an XML sub-entity of the procedure entity. The return value of the function is the entity inside the SOAP body of the response. In debug mode the return value is an array of 3 elements; the non-debug return value (if any) as element 0, the XML text of the request as element 1 and the XML text of the server response as element 2. This function does not use any XML types when creating the XML. It represents types as a cast to varchar would, with one exception - dates and times according to ISO8061.

This will cause type checking and validation of the values to be encoded for SOAP request.

refsect2.title: host
refsect2.para: DNS name or IP address of the SOAP server

refsect2.title: path
refsect2.para: path into the HTTP server containing the SOAP server page

refsect2.title: methodURI
refsect2.para: URI of the SOAP method being called

refsect2.title: methodName
refsect2.para: Name of the SOAP method being called

refsect2.title: params
refsect2.para: array of parameters to the SOAP call; array of (ParamName, Value). The Virtuoso SOAP client can work with complex datatypes. In order to support this the parameters array must conform to the following convention: vector ( vector ([name1], [type1]), value1, vector ([name2], [type2]), value2 ...). This will cause type checking and validation of the values to be encoded for SOAP request.

refsect2.title: version
refsect2.para: the SOAP version used in call (SOAP 1.0 = 1, SOAP 1.1 = 11). Default value = SOAP 1.0. If the value is negated : i.e. -1 or -11 then the soap_call procedure enters "debug" mode

refsect2.title: certificate
refsect2.para: If this parameter is specified (string or null) the HTTPS operation will be performed. Path to the HTTPS client certificate in PKCS#12 format, if this parameter is set to NULL then client will do only encrypted connection.

refsect2.title: password
refsect2.para: If certificate is supplied this parameter must contain password for opening the certificate file.

refsect2.title: SOAPAction
refsect2.para: SOAPAction parameter can be used to make SOAPAction header value explicit. Normally this is taken from the namespace URI and SOAP method name.
